description.narrative: The project aims to prevent hiv/aids by cultural sensitive family counselling, marriage seminars and training of trainers. Awareness raising and campaigns are conducted in secondary schools. Widows and young people affected by hiv/aids are granted micro cr edits.The local cultural habits and taboos are one of the main reasons for high hiv and aids prevalence in the Iringa-Makambako area. The project takes hold in these cultural root causes in order to change attitudes and behaviour to reduce the spread of hi v and aids.Through trainings people learn to recognise the link between the spread of hiv and aids and their cultural habits and this motivates them to behaviour change. Training of trainers aims to retain the knowledge and spread it forward within the com munities. Secondary school students get information and support and widows and young people living in a difficult situations can improve their lives by micro credit scheme.The beneficiaries of the project are families and communities in Iringa-Makambako ar ea, particularly women and girls who are affected by hiv and aids and who are living in contradiction between the traditional models and modern world.The project is implemented by University of Iringa UOI (formerly ELCT Tumaini University Iringa University College IUCO). The university has good knowledge of and experience in counselling and research of local traditions.
